column1: Mahishadal is a small suburb in Mahishadal CD block in Haldia subdivision of Purba Medinipur district in the state of West Bengal
== Eminent personalities ==
Satish Chandra Samanta – Indian independence movement activist.
Suryakant Tripathi 'Nirala' – one of the most significant poets of modern Hindi literature. He went to school at Mahishadal.
== Geography ==
=== Mahishadal Rajbari ===
A businessman from north India
column3: developed a large estate in the 16th century. During the days of Rani Janaki Devi
column4: it reached its zenith in the 18th century.

column1: There are two palaces – the old one was built in 1840 and the new one in 1935. One can see stuffed animals
column2: hunting weapons of the 16th and 17th century
column3: paintings and furniture. Gopaljew and Ramjew temples are popular with tourists. The place is half an hours drive from Haldia.

column1: === Police station ===
Mahishadal police station has jurisdiction over Mahishadal CD block. Mahishadal police station covers an area of 135 km2 with a population of 182
column2: 365. The police station is located at Garh Kamalpur mouza.

column1: === CD block HQ ===
The headquarters of Mahishadal CD block are located at Rangibasan.
=== Urbanisation ===
79.19% of the population of Haldia subdivision live in the rural areas. Only 20.81% of the population live in the urban areas
column2: and that is the highest proportion of urban population amongst the four subdivisions in Purba Medinipur district.Note: The map above presents some of the notable locations in the subdivision. All places marked in the map are linked in the larger full screen map.

column1: == Demographics ==
As per the map of Mahishadal CD block and subsequent alphabetical list of villages in the District Census Handbook
column3: Mahishadal is a part of Rangibasan village.As per 2011 Census of India Rangibasan had a total population of 2
column6: 249 (49%) were females. Population below 6 years was 231. The total number of literates in Rangibasan was 2

column1: == Transport ==
The Mecheda-Tamluk-Haldia Road passes through Mahishadal.
Mahishadal railway station and Satish Samanta Halt railway station are railway stations on the Panskura-Haldia line.
== Education ==
Mahishadal Raj College was established at Garh Kamalpur in 1946. A coeducational institution
column2: it is affiliated to Vidyasagar University. It offers courses in arts
column3: science and commerce.Mahishadal Girls College was established in 1969 with the initiative of Dr. Satyendranath Bhuniya
column6: Gopal Chandra Mondal and others. Affiliated to Vidyasagar University
column7: it offers courses in arts and science.

column1: == Culture ==
David J. McCutchion mentions the Madan Gopala temple as a West Bengal nava-ratna
== Healthcare ==
Basulia Rural Hospital located at nearby Basulia (with 30 beds) is the main medical facility in Mahishadal CD block. There are primary health centres at Natsal
